questions.explanation:
7. Who's picking up the newspaper?
(A) Some paper napkins. → Incorrect (unrelated to picking up the newspaper)
(B) Camille said she will. → Correct (identifies who is picking up the newspaper)
(C) He took out the trash. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

8. When is your doctor's appointment?
(A) This afternoon. → Correct (specifies the time of the appointment)
(B) That's a good point. → Incorrect (unrelated to the appointment time)
(C) At a medical clinic. → Incorrect (refers to location, not time)

9. Why don't we have a company picnic?
(A) Potato salad and green beans. → Incorrect (refers to food, not the reason)
(B) Because it costs a lot of money. → Correct (explains why no picnic is planned)
(C) I already have that one. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

10. What do you think I should take to the conference?
(A) In the lobby. → Incorrect (refers to location, not items)
(B) Just your laptop. → Correct (suggests an item to bring)
(C) A three o'clock shift. → Incorrect (unrelated to conference items)

11. Where's the festival being held?
(A) A music concert. → Incorrect (describes the event, not location)
(B) Probably sometime in December. → Incorrect (refers to time, not location)
(C) In the town center. → Correct (specifies the festival location)

12. Who do I present my proposal to?
(A) A hotel reservation. → Incorrect (unrelated to presenting the proposal)
(B) The acquisitions committee. → Correct (identifies the proposal recipient)
(C) At noon today. → Incorrect (refers to time, not recipient)

13. Could you please look up the location on your phone?
(A) Here's my phone number. → Incorrect (unrelated to looking up a location)
(B) OK, one moment. → Correct (agrees to check the location)
(C) The weather is nice right now. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the request)

14. Isn't the accounting seminar tomorrow?
(A) I'd like to open an account, please. → Incorrect (unrelated to the seminar)
(B) Actually, it's on Friday. → Correct (corrects the seminar date)
(C) Time management. → Incorrect (refers to a topic, not the date)

15. When's the dishwasher being repaired?
(A) The technician came this morning. → Correct (indicates the repair time)
(B) I store the knives in a separate drawer. → Incorrect (unrelated to the repair)
(C) The bread is in the pantry. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

16. Should we move the employee lounge to the basement?
(A) He attended the talk. → Incorrect (unrelated to the lounge move)
(B) The reservation is for two people. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) No, it's too dark down there. → Correct (provides a reason against the move)

17. You changed the color printer cartridge recently, didn't you?
(A) Right, just a few days ago. → Correct (confirms the cartridge change)
(B) They're painting the walls blue. → Incorrect (unrelated to the printer)
(C) A different password. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

18. We're not going to be able to fit everyone in this space.
(A) A professional-development workshop. → Incorrect (unrelated to space issue)
(B) There's a larger room down the hallway. → Correct (offers a solution for space)
(C) These shoes are exactly the right size. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

19. Is it easiest for me to take a bus to the city center?
(A) A new department store. → Incorrect (unrelated to transportation)
(B) When did you buy it? → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I usually do. → Correct (implies bus is a common choice)

20. Are you able to make a prototype soon?
(A) Yes, my team is working on it. → Correct (confirms ability to make prototype)
(B) I thought it was very innovative. → Incorrect (unrelated to ability)
(C) He's a good typist. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

21. Where can I buy a lamp like that?
(A) On my desk. → Incorrect (refers to location of lamp, not purchase)
(B) I got this one as a gift. → Correct (implies purchase information indirectly)
(C) After my client meeting. → Incorrect (refers to time, not purchase)

22. How often do you have to install updates?
(A) This letter needs more postage. → Incorrect (unrelated to updates)
(B) An incorrect serial code. → Incorrect (irrelevant to update frequency)
(C) Waseem is the software administrator. → Correct (points to the person who knows)

23. Let's talk about your project after lunch.
(A) Because her microphone is broken. → Incorrect (unrelated to the project discussion)
(B) I'm leaving work early today. → Correct (implies unavailability, this answer)
(C) I have two pairs of shoes. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

24. Is there a list of guests who have been invited?
(A) Room 305 is being prepared for you. → Incorrect (unrelated to the guest list)
(B) The caterer has all the necessary information. → Correct (indicates where to find the list)
(C) A banquet hall on Main Street. → Incorrect (refers to location, not the list)

25. Would it be cheaper to ship by express mail or overnight delivery?
(A) Express mail is less expensive. → Correct (compares shipping costs)
(B) I'd like a large. → Incorrect (unrelated to shipping)
(C) It's in the next shipment. → Incorrect (irrelevant to cost comparison)

26. How do I turn on the air conditioner in this office?
(A) The temperature is controlled automatically. → Correct (explains how the AC works)
(B) Turn left after the post office. → Incorrect (refers to directions, not AC)
(C) No, I shut off all the lights. → Incorrect (unrelated to the air conditioner)

27. Have you trained Hikaru to use the new microscope?
(A) I have my own car. → Incorrect (unrelated to training)
(B) That's enough, thanks. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I misplaced the instruction manual. → Correct (implies training status)

28. We're meeting this week to discuss the upcoming merger.
(A) I have it on my calendar. → Correct (confirms the meeting)
(B) Please merge onto the highway. → Incorrect (unrelated to the merger meeting)
(C) A law firm in Glenview. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the meeting)

29. How long will we have to wait for a taxi to arrive?
(A) About twelve kilometers. → Incorrect (refers to distance, not time)
(B) No, I don't think so. → Incorrect (unrelated to wait time)
(C) Would you prefer to walk? → Correct (suggests an alternative, this answer)

30. Did the deal to lease the equipment go through?
(A) A one-bedroom apartment. → Incorrect (unrelated to the equipment lease)
(B) The supply catalog is in the filing cabinet. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the deal)
(C) Not yet-but we hope to have it finalized this quarter. → Correct (updates on the deal status)

31. Would you like to take this vehicle for a test drive?
(A) Because there's no parking available. → Incorrect (unrelated to test drive)
(B) I heard a new model is coming out in March. → Correct (refers to a future model, this answer)
(C) Only two doors. → Incorrect (describes the vehicle, not test drive)
